item.title: Report X-2024101221
item.description:
Report X-2024101221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-23T09:14:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIS REPORT DOES NOT INVOLVE A SPILL, GOODS MISSING OR GOODS MISSING COMPONENTS. UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER OPEN WITH GOODS LOOSE. PACKAGE DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION, VERY FEEBLE BOX. LQ MARKING COVERED OVER BY SHIPPING LABEL. FOUR CANS MISSING, FIVE CANS WITH MISSING COVERS AND BUTTONS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024100482
item.description:
Report E-2024100482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a NA1760 Starlite release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to a 12’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a loose bung cap. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and neutralized. The drums were wiped down and the cap was tightened for shipment on. The impacted pads, neutralizer, and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100425
item.description:
Report E-2024100425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 8, 2024, four (4) 6-liter pails of UN1263 were damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the product-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged pallets were broken down and all undamaged product was repalletized for future shipping. All spent absorbents, and damaged product were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2024100363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bag of UN2680 was torn in transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged bags and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024100918
item.description:
Report X-2024100918

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-28
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAR DRIVER WAS SUSPICIOUS OF THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE. THEREFORE HE BROUGHT IT TO THE ACCEPTANCE AUDITOR WHO THEN BROUGHT IT TO MY, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER, ATTENTION. OPENED THE PACKAGE TO CONFIRM THE CONTENTS AND DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT AND LACKED ANY OF THE LABELING AND PAPERWORK FOR A PROPER HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SHIPMENT. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZC1G375YT43362982, 1ZC1G375YT52733242, 1ZC1G375YT51848773, 1ZC1G375YT44826961, 1ZC1G375YW56285134, 1ZC1G375YT98949693, 1ZC1G375YT86212287, 1ZC1G375YT50041556, 1ZC1G375YT48566253 AND 1ZC1G375YT63739663

item.title: Report X-2024100711
item.description:
Report X-2024100711

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: Sacremento
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/25/2024 at approximately 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 957951 at the ramp facility in Sacramento, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing two fiberboard boxes with a fire extinguisher in each inner box. The shipment was discovered showing a powder residue on the outer package and on the aircraft floor. Further investigation revealed that the shipment contained fire extinguishers that were missing the secure pin. Additionally, the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork on the outermost pacakge. The shipment is being held, pending in FAA investigation.
